Articles.Content:
Retro Future Mod?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/84054-v0-90-v-25-Transparent-Pods-v1-2-2-for-KSP-v0-90

I think he's talking about the engine in my first post. The C-130.

It is the turboprop from the Firespitter mod.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24551-Firespitter-propeller-plane-and-helicopter-parts-v6-3-5-%28Sep-1st%29-for-KSP-0-24-2

While the cockpit and passenger parts look great,

the cargo fuselage parts and the ramp part seem to have broken textures.

Their lighting seems to ignore the model itself and other attached models.

While they seem to register where the light sources are, the shadows and brightness are not correctly displayed.

I have no idea why it works on the passenger fuselage, but not on the cargo bays parts.

While the cockpit and passenger parts look great,

the cargo fuselage parts and the ramp part seem to have broken textures.

Their lighting seems to ignore the model itself and other attached models.

While they seem to register where the light sources are, the shadows and brightness are not correctly displayed.

I have no idea why it works on the passenger fuselage, but not on the cargo bays parts.

This bother me for quiet some time, but I just can't find out what the problem is. If there is someone who has an idea, I'd be very glad.

Hey, I've got a new part for you The K-737 Cockpit.

The E-2 has also made some progress. Some ideas or Feedback?

Edited February 21, 2015 by FreddyPhantom

They really look awesome!

Did you add any IVAs?

Maybe you could add the radar of the E-2 ,so we can build the whole plane.

- - - Updated - - -

I've noticed some issues with the cargo bay, too. I can't seem to be able to place anything "inside" it, just on the corners like it is solid or something.

They really look awesome!

Did you add any IVAs?

Maybe you could add the radar of the E-2 ,so we can build the whole plane.

- - - Updated - - -

I've noticed some issues with the cargo bay, too. I can't seem to be able to place anything "inside" it, just on the corners like it is solid or something.

I've no experiences with IVA's yet but I'd love to add IVA's

I'll fix the issues with the cargo bay in the next updates currently I try to improve the E-2 Cockpit, so I can release it soon.

Do you think, the radar should have the ability of producing science?

Do you think, the radar should have the ability of producing science?

It should be able to do something, like provide low-altitude, high-resolution SCANsat data. I'm not certain what radar scans should result in Science rewards, but I'll give it some thought.

I've managed to mock-up a radar disc like that using Procedural Fairings. You might try that to test something or other.

Edited February 21, 2015 by ultrasquid

It should be able to do something, like provide low-altitude, high-resolution SCANsat data. I'm not certain what radar scans should result in Science rewards, but I'll give it some thought.

I've managed to mock-up a radar disc like that using Procedural Fairings. You might try that to test something or other.

If you, or someone else, have more or specific ideas, I'd love to hear of what I could do with the radar I appreciate every support

-Freddy

Edited February 21, 2015 by FreddyPhantom

Well, I think the idea of ultrasquid is good. With SCANsat you have a goal to build this plane.

Maybe the science reward can be like 3 science points per scanned square meter or square feet if that is possible.

Well, I think the idea of ultrasquid is good. With SCANsat you have a goal to build this plane.

Maybe the science reward can be like 3 science points per scanned square meter or square feet if that is possible.

To be honest I have no expirience with SCANsat or something like this. Do you, or anyone else know how to integrate it in self made parts....or is it very easy...? thanks in advance

DMagic is probably the one to ask about SCANsat matters, since he's maintaining the mod. Source files are available on GitHub, if you want to examine them.

EDIT: This specific post may have the information you need to add SCANsat features to your parts. Of course you'd have to adjust the altitude and field of view numbers for atmospheric use.

Edited February 22, 2015 by ultrasquid
added more info

FreddyPhantom, I made a plane like the Boeing 737 Peace eye.

http://s76.photobucket.com/user/DeepSlay/library/KSP%20Creations?sort=3&page=1

It flies very good and it's got some science on it, too.

DMagic is probably the one to ask about SCANsat matters, since he's maintaining the mod. Source files are available on GitHub, if you want to examine them.

EDIT: This specific post may have the information you need to add SCANsat features to your parts.

Thank you very much

FreddyPhantom, I made a plane like the Boeing 737 Peace eye.

http://s76.photobucket.com/user/DeepSlay/library/KSP%20Creations?sort=3&page=1

It flies very good and it's got some science on it, too.

Looks nice. Love to see my parts being used.

- - - Updated - - -

Tests of the model of the radar on the K-2 Kerbeye starting now:

...and some inspiration...the Boeing 737-800 and 707

Edited February 22, 2015 by FreddyPhantom
The K-2 Kerbeye Looks nice.
Where are the Boeing turbofans from, Freddy?

B9 Aerospace

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92630-0-90-B9-Aerospace-Release-5-2-8-%28updated-30-12-14%29
Dang. I suppose I'll have to install a cut-down version of B9, then.

Another Idea:

Can you add a cockpit like the Bombardier CRJ-family?

Would be awesome

Another Idea:

Can you add a cockpit like the Bombardier CRJ-family?

Would be awesome

Yeah, that's an awesome idea.

But wouldn't a "KRJ-family" cockpit rather have the diameter of 1.875m, or would 1.25 be okay. Some opinions?

Yeah, that's an awesome idea.

But wouldn't a "KRJ-family" cockpit rather have the diameter of 1.875m, or would 1.25 be okay. Some opinions?

From the looks of that plane, it's definitely bigger than 1.25 when kerbal-scaled, but still pretty small. 1.875m is probably about right, but you'd need to build passenger tubes and a tail point to go with it. They seat 4 across in Economy, but the aisle in the middle looks narrower than what you'd see in a 737.

Edited February 25, 2015 by ultrasquid
Like this! Rep for you, sir!
Well I think 1.875m is alright for the KRJ size cockpit

From the looks of that plane, it's definitely bigger than 1.25 when kerbal-scaled, but still pretty small. 1.875m is probably about right, but you'd need to build passenger tubes and a tail point to go with it. They seat 4 across in Economy, but the aisle in the middle looks narrower than what you'd see in a 737.
Well I think 1.875m is alright for the KRJ size cockpit

Okay, I think I can't get around 1.875m parts ..this will be a lot of work...at least 3 parts...cockpit (I love the crj cockpit), fuselage, tail. Some ideas for other useful parts?

-Freddy

Okay, I think I can't get around 1.875m parts ..this will be a lot of work...at least 3 parts...cockpit (I love the crj cockpit), fuselage, tail. Some ideas for other useful parts?

-Freddy

Wing mount "shoulders", so you can also build the Q series off this.

Wing mount "shoulders", so you can also build the Q series off this.

Awesome, I will do this ...I want to fly it noooow!!
